intro: Meibomia gracilis, commonly known as the slender meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Meibomia gracilis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
